intro: Rosa coriifolia f. manasiana, commonly known as the Manasana shrub rose, is a compact, deciduous shrub native to the eastern Himalayas. It features distinctive, fragrant flowers with five pink to red petals, often with a white or pale pink base. The plant has thornless stems and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers typically bloom in early spring, adding ornamental value to gardens. It is well-suited for rock gardens and prefers well-drained, alkaline soils.
